rating_comment:
Slightly difficult to find in the dark (directions need to mention the tyre shop) but once we were there we had a lovely warm welcome.
The house and room were beautifully decorated and very comfortable.
Had noodles and momos from a nearby dhaba which was nice.
Overall a wonderful stay and so convenient for the airport.

This is the second time I’m staying at Manpreet’s place - had a comfortable stay and it’s proximity to Bagdogra airport is amazing!
Easy to communicate with Manpreet and she’s extremely accommodating.
Def will stay again if passing through the region.
It would be better to provide clear location information instead of coordinates. Please provide closest landmark.Especially difficult to provide address to Uber or taxi drivers

What a beautiful villa. Well maintained and we loved it. It is very close to Bagdogra airport which is another plus point. The caretaker Barsha is extremely polite and helpful. We stayed one night only. Definitely that is not enough to explore the villa. Will visit again.
Our stay was pleasant and comfortable

The house was beautiful with beautiful view.! We stayed only for a night but we felt like were at home, Barkha didi was very hospitable, she served us very nice karak chai ☕️
Thank you Manpreet for hosting us, hope to see you soon.!

Beautiful villa with a terrace and lovely view of tea gardens. Really peaceful stay
Walking distance from Bagdogra airport
Will def stay here if passing through the region again.
Thanks Manpreet
As described, care takers are very kind and accommodating.

We were here for a night and enjoyed our stay. Loved the view from the balcony; great place to have chai along with the view! The location is perfect - just 5 minutes away from the airport. Manpreet (our host) was super-quick to communicate with - helped us reach the place smoothly, shared details for a local taxi and recommendations to eat (food was great at Marina’s hotel). If we’re in Bagdogra, we’ll plan to stay here again.

Totally enchanting place. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were very tastefully decorated with period pieces. The tea estates view from the balcony made our stay memorable. The short drive from Bagdogra airport was very convenient, especially the car/driver arrangement the hostess provided. Highly recommended.

Stones throw away from Bagdogra airport.
Expect no meals at house , at least we didn’t get it.
Expect a rudimentary breakfast.
Very near to bagdogra airport very clean too.

We could not check in as the villa was having no power due to rains and storms... The host was really good to make sure we are comfortable. Mrs. Daljit made sure we got a nearby hotel room despite being full due to tourist rush.. The host is really caring and friendly.. Will definitely visit again to experience the place ...

My father and I stayed at Daljit and Minna's villa in Bagdogra en route to Sikkim. My father is an elderly man for whom this break in travel was important and necessary, and I first found this place when I thought I did not want to put him through a gruelling travel routine.

And so I asked Daljit to stay in their villa, as the photographs looked most charming. I must admit, it was more charming and lovely in real life! Daljit and Minna went absolutely out of their way to make sure my father and I were looked after, in fact, making us feel like old family friends. Both of them, and Blues their little spaniel, are excellent company, sharing with us their stories as we did ours. We were given the esteem and regard that we usually reserve for those we know personally -- something that only very generous hosts can do. And for this I am most grateful.

Their place helps stagger your travel if you want to rest, and if you want to figure out some know-how about things to do. The hosts are also wonderful in helping with ways of organising transport, telling you about things to do, though I feel we troubled them too much!

Thanks again, for a lovely few days -- which were as nice as our time in the mountains!
